description: Extensions to existing public house (Use Class Sui Generis) and ancillary former stable building, with retention of public house use at ground floor and partial change of use to provide 9 self-contained residential units (Use Class C3), with associated internal and external alterations, kitchen extraction, cycle storage, and refuse storage
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.

Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be retained in accordance with drawing title number(s): 19116-13-B-BG Existing Basement & Ground Floor Plan, 19116-13-B-R Existing Roof Plan, 19116-13-B-T Existing Topographical Survey, 19116-13-B-12 Existing First & Second Floor Plan, 19116-E-GA Existing Elevations 1, 19116-E-GA1 Existing Elevations 2 and 3, 19116-E-GA2 Existing Elevations 4 and 5, 19116-13-E-GA3 Existing Elevations 6 and 7, 19116-13-E-GA4 Existing Elevation 8, 19116-13-S-GA Existing Sections A-A and B-B, AL(00)001 Rev A Location Map, AL(00)002 Rev A Block Plan, AL(01)099 Rev A Basement Floor Plan, AL(01)100 Rev F Ground Floor Plan, AL(01)101 Rev E First Floor Plan, AL(01)102 Rev E Second Floor Plan, AL(01)103 Rev D Roof Plan, AL(01)110 Rev B Demolition Plans, AL(01)120 Rev B Alteration Plans, AL(01)120 Rev A Retained Features Schedule Ground Floor, AL(01)121 Rev A Retained Features Schedule First Floor, AL(01)122 Rev A Retained Features Schedule Second Floor, AL(02)220 Rev C Section AA, AL(03)320 Rev C South Ealing Road, South & East Elevations, AL(03)360 Rev D West & North Elevations, Air Quality Assessment prepared by eb7 dated 9 October 2020, Updated Built Heritage Statement prepared by RPS Group dated February 2022, Design and Access Statement prepared by Autor Architecture dated March 2022, Heritage Response prepared by Autor Architecture dated July 2021, Noise Impact Assessment prepared by Environmental Noise Solutions Limited dated 12 October 2020, Planning Statement prepared by Savills dated February 2022, Statement of Community Involvement prepared by Your Shout dated October 2020, Structural Engineering Notes on the Condition of the Building prepared by R &S Property Associates Ltd dated February 2022, Sustainable Design and Construction Statement prepared by eb7 dated 24 September 2020, Transport Statement prepared by Royal Haskoning DHV dated 17 September 2020.

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building and/or shall be consistent with those as listed within the submitted application form and the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7B & 7C of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013) and Policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2013). | Cycle storage for fifteen (15) bicycle spaces shall be provided within the curtilage of the building, within a secure, lockable compound in accordance with all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy T5 of the London Plan (2021). | The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage within an enclosure has been provided, as listed within the drawings / plans in Condition (2) in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policies SI7 and SI8 of the London Plan (2021). | No part of the flat roofs of the hereby approved development, except those listed in the drawings / plans in Condition (2), shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof terrace/garden or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties and future occupiers of the development, in accordance with policies 7B and 7D of the Ealing Development Management Plan (2013) and policy D6 of the London Plan (2021). | The hours of operation of the ground floor commercial unit shall be restricted to 08:00 until 00:00hrs Mondays to Sundays and Public Holidays. The hours of operation of the pub garden shall be restricted to 10:00 until 22:00hrs Mondays to Sundays and Public Holidays. No deliveries nor collections/ loading nor unloading shall occur at the development other than between the hours of 08:00 to 18:00 on Monday to Saturdays and at no time on Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays, except for waste collections which may take place daily.

Reason: In the interests of safeguarding the residential amenity of nearby residents in accordance with Policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013), Supplementary Planning Guidance 10 Noise and Vibration, Policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The enhanced sound insulation and noise mitigation measures stated within the Acoustic Report dated 3 March 2021 shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | A noise limiting device shall be installed to the electrical circuit for control of the sound level emitted by amplified music or speech and be set to a maximum level of 75dBA Leq.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D14 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The sound insulation of the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses, namely, kitchen/living/dining/ bathroom adjoining bedroom of separate dwellings, should be enhanced by at least 5dB above the recommended Building Regulations value. The assessment and mitigation measures shall be based on standards of the Council's SPG10 and the criteria of BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021), Standard 30 of the Housing SPG and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to use, machinery, plant or equipment/ extraction/ ventilation system and ducting at the commercial and residential parts of the development shall be mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors shall be vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced and maintained as such.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration/noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | The individual and combined external sound level emitted from plant, machinery or equipment at the development site shall be lower than the lowest existing background sound level by at least 10dBA, as measured at/ calculated to the nearest and most affected noise sensitive premises at the development site and at surrounding premises. The assessment shall be made in accordance with BS4142:2014, with all machinery operating together at maximum capacity.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by vibration/noise from mechanical installations/ equipment, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | Notwithstanding the reports submitted with this planning application, prior to the commencement of development, a Construction Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:
-	Details of construction hours;

-	Noise/Vibration mitigation measures. Information submitted should directly cross-reference with the BPM & mitigation measures as detailed in the BS 5228-1:2009+A1:2014 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise, BS 5228-2:2009+A1:2014;
-	Details of enclosure of working areas and the location of compounds for the storage of plant and materials;
-	Site security during construction;
-	Construction methods;
-	Site management and access;
-	Vehicle and machinery specifications;
-	Numbers / frequency of vehicles/deliveries;
-	Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents.

The Construction Management Plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of demolition and construction.

Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of the works, in accordance with policies 1.1 (e) (f) (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy 2012, policies D6, D14 and T5 of the London Plan (2021) and policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan (2013). | The Noise Impact Assessment prepared by Environmental Noise Solutions Limited dated 12 October 2020, which includes details of glazing specifications and mitigation measures shall be implemented prior to the occupation of the development.

Reason: In the interests of the living conditions of the future occupiers of the site in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies 7A & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policy D6 of The London Plan (2021), Ealing SPG10 and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021). | The use shall not commence until all external doors to the commercial premises /kitchens /function rooms have been fitted with self-closing devices, which shall be maintained in an operational condition and at no time shall any external door nor windows to rooms where noise, smell, smoke or fumes may be emitted, be fixed in an open position.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise /odour /smoke /fumes, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | No removal of refuse nor bottles/ cans to external bins or areas at the development shall be carried out other than between the hours of 08:00 to 22:00 on Monday to Sundays and Public/Bank Holidays.
Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site/ surrounding

premises is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with Policy 1.1(j) of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021), the National Planning Policy Framework (2021) and Interim guidance SPG 10 'Noise and Vibration'. | All Non-Road Mobile Machinery (NRMM) of net power of 37kW and up to and including 560kW used during the course of the demolition, site preparation and construction phases shall comply with the emission standards set out in chapter 7 of the GLA's supplementary planning guidance "Control of Dust and Emissions During Construction and Demolition" dated July 2014 (SPG), or subsequent guidance. Unless it complies with the standards set out in the SPG, no NRMM shall be on site, at any time, whether in use or not, without the prior written consent of the local planning authority. The developer shall keep an up to date list of all NRMM used during the demolition, site preparation and construction phases of the development on the online register at https://nrmm.london/.

Reason: To promote sustainable design and construction to reduce emissions from the demolition and construction of buildings in accordance with London Plan policy D14, policy 7A of the Ealing DM DPD and The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition SPG (GLA). | Details shall be submitted prior to occupation of the development for approval by the Local Planning Authority, for the installation in each dwelling of an Ultra Low NOx boiler with maximum NOx Emissions of under 0.030 g/kWh. The works, as approved, shall be completed prior to occupation and thereafter permanently retained.

Reason: In order to comply with Ealing Council's commitment to being an Air Quality Exemplar Borough and policy SI1 of the London Plan (2021). | No new plant, enclosure or other equipment shall be erected outside the building envelope hereby approved.

Reason: To safeguard the character and appearance of the Listed Building in accordance with policy 7C of the adopted Ealing Development Management Development Plan, policies 1.1(h) and 1.2(g) of the Adopted Ealing Development Core Strategy 2012 and policy HC1 of the London Plan (2021).
